motion.title: Supporting for string or symbol when outputting observed variables in NetCDFOutputter()
motion.description:
We could easily select and output observed variables (such as the pressure `GEOSFPâ‚ŠP(t)`) by creating a vector of symbolics as `extra_vars_selected` as the attached code snippet. A suggestion could be to make it possible for `extra_vars` being a vector of string or symbol.
```julia
using ModelingToolkit
using EarthSciMLBase, EarthSciData, EnvironmentalTransport
using GasChem, AtmosphericDeposition
using Dates
using NCDatasets

model_ = couple(
    domain,
    NEI2016MonthlyEmis("mrggrid_withbeis_withrwc", domain;scale = 0.1),
    GEOSFP("0.5x0.625_NA", domain),
    GEOSChemGasPhase(),
    FastJX(get_tref(domain)),
    DryDepositionGas(),
    WetDeposition(),
    AdvectionOperator(NaN, upwind1_stencil, ConstantBC(0.0)),
    #NetCDFOutputter(outfile, 3600f0),
)

model_sys_ = convert(System, model_ )

extra_vars_selected = []

#output all observed
for i in observed(model_sys_ )
    push!(extra_vars_selected, i.lhs)
end

model = couple(
    model_ ,
    NetCDFOutputter(outfile, 3600f0; extra_vars = extra_vars_selected),
)
```
